result.reason: Already implemented via --connect and --startup command-line arguments in StartupArgumentsInterpreter.cs; user can run mRemoteNG.exe --connect "ConnectionName" to auto-open a connection on startup
result.approach: Feature already exists. The --connect flag accepts a connection name or ID and auto-opens it. If single-instance forwarding to existing window is needed, that would be a separate enhancement.

attempts.raw_output:
Based on my analysis, mRemoteNG already has `--connect` and `--startup` command-line arguments in `StartupArgumentsInterpreter.cs` that auto-open a connection by name/ID on startup. The feature request is largely already implemented. The remaining question is whether it works when mRemoteNG is already running (single-instance behavior, opening in a new tab of the existing instance).

The --connect flag accepts a connection name or ID and auto-opens it. If single-instance forwarding to existing window is needed, that would be a separate enhancement."}
